turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: Me!? Why would anyone want to kill me?!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Don't ask -- just give me some help nailing this guy when I bring him out.

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: Bring him out of what?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: My dream.

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: How you plan to do that?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just like I did the hat. Have a hold of the sucker when you wake me up.

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: Me?  Wait a minute, you can't bring someone out of a dream!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: If I can't, then you all can relax, because it'll just be a simple case of me being nuts.

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: I can save you the trouble. You're nutty as a fruitcake. I love you anyway.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Good, then you won't mind cold-cocking this guy when I bring him out.

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You heard me. I grab him in the dream -- you see me struggling so you wake me up. We both come out, you cold cock the fucker, and we got him. Clever, huh?

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: You crazy? Hit him with what?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You're a jock. You must have a baseball bat or something. Come to my window at midnight. And meanwhile...

turns.speaker: GLEN
turns.text: Meanwhile...?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Meanwhile whatever you do don't fall asleep. Midnight.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: How you doing, pal?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Okay. Hi, dad.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Rod's not a lunatic.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: You got a sane explanation for what he did?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: She dreamed this would happen...

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: She had a nightmare about somebody trying to kill her, last night. That's why we were there; she was afraid to sleep alone.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You used me, daddy!

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: What the hell you doing going to school today, anyway -- your mother told me you didn't even sleep last night!

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Decide to take a day off after all?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Dad, I want to see Rod Lane.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Only family allowed, Nancy. You know the drill.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just want to talk to him a second.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: He's dangerous.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You don't know he did it.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: No, I know, thanks to your own testimony, that he was locked in a room with a girl who went in alive and came out in a rubber bag.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Dad -- what you doing here?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: It so happens I work here, and there's an unsolved murder. I don't like unsolved murders, especially ones my daughter's mixed up in -- what are you doing here at this hour? You're supposed to be getting some sleep.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Hello Nancy.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Hi daddy. I know what happened.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Then you know more than I do -- I haven't even been upstairs.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You know he's dead though, right?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I've got a proposition for you. Listen very carefully, please.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Nan, I --

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Please. I'm gonna go get the guy who did it and bring him to you. I just need you be right there to arrest him. Okay?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Just tell me who did it and I'll go get him, baby.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Fred Krueger did it, Daddy, and only I can get him. It's my nightmare he comes to.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: -- I want you to come over here and break the door down exactly twenty minutes from now -- can you do that?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Sure, but...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: That'll be exactly half past midnight. Time for me to fall asleep and find him.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Sure, sure, honey. You just do that -- get yourself some sleep -- that's what I've been saying all along.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: And you'll be here to catch him, right?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Sure, okay, I'll be there. Now you just turn in and get some rest, sweetheart. Please. Deal?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: DAD! GET US OUTTA HERE!

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Oh, Jesus -- Nancy!  Hey! We got a fire!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Lieutenant Thompson. Sorry to wake you, but --

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: I'd've canned your ass if you hadn't. What you got?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: What's the Coroner got to say?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Something like a razor was the weapon, but nothing found on the scene.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Looks like her boyfriend did it. Rod Lane. Musician type, arrests for brawling, dope --

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Terrific. What the hell was she doing there?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: She lived there.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: I don't mean her --

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Tell her I'm not here, tell her...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Uh, she just saw you, sir...

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Get outside and watch her house. If you see anything funny call me.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: 'Anything funny' like what?

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Who? Who did that?

turns.speaker: MR LANTZ
turns.text: Krueger.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Krueger?

turns.speaker: MR LANTZ
turns.text: Had to've done it. No one else was in there.

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: How you know that?

turns.speaker: MR LANTZ
turns.text: Cause I thought Glen was gonna sneak out to see your lunatic daughter, that's why. So I locked him in his room!  Sorry. Anyways, the door was still locked when we heard the screams.

turns.speaker: MR LANTZ
turns.text: Maybe god's punishing us all...

turns.speaker: LT THOMPSON
turns.text: Keep your head -- this is a fucking flesh and blood killer we're talking about.

turns.speaker: MR LANTZ
turns.text: Like Rod Lane?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Apparently he was crazy jealous. Nancy said they'd had a fight, Rod and Tina.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It wasn't that serious...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Maybe you don't think murder's serious --

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Where you think you're going?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: School.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I could hear you tossing and turning all night, kiddo. You've no business going to school.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Did you sleep?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'll sleep in study hall, promise. I'd rather keep busy, you know?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Right home after.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Right home after. See you.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Nancy, don't fall asleep in there.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Get into bed.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You're not falling asleep, are you? You could drown, you know.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Mother, for petesakes.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: It happens all the time.  I've got some warm milk all ready for you. Why don't you jump into bed?  I'm gonna turn on your electric blanket, too. C'mon, now.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Warm milk. Gross.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Great

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: To bed with you, c'mon.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: No television, forget the homework, no phone calls.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No, Mother. Yes, Mother. No, Mother.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: And no school tomorrow, either. You take a little vacation, relax and rest for a change.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Yes, Mother. G'night.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Take this, it'll help you sleep.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I must be going nuts...

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Nancy?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Yeah. Just had a little dream. I'm falling right back to sleep.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Okay... You need anything, just call.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Go even crazier?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I don't think you're going crazy -- and stop drinking that damn coffee!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Did you ask Daddy to have the hat examined?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I threw that filthy thing away -- I don't know what you're trying to prove with it, but --

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What I learned at the dream clinic, that's what I'm trying to prove. Rod didn't kill Tina, and he didn't hang himself. It's this guy -- he's after us in our dreams.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: But that's just not reality, Nancy!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It's real, Mamma. Feel it.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Put that damned thing down!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Screw sleep!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Nancy!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What's with the bars?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: S'curity.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Mom, I want to know what you know about Fred Krueger.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Dead and gone.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I want to know how, where -- if you don't tell me, I'm going to call daddy.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Your father the cop. That's a good one.  Forget Fred Krueger. You don't want to know, believe me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I do want to know. He's not dead and gone -- he's after me and if I sleep he'll get me! I've got to know!

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Oh lawyers got fat and the judge got famous, but someone forgot to sign the search warrant in the right place, and Fred Krueger was free, just like that.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: So he's alive?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Bunch of us parents tracked him down after they let him go. Found him in an old boiler room, just like before. Saw him lying there in that caked red and yellow sweater he always wore, drunk an' asleep with his weird knives by his side...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Go on...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: All these years you've kept those things buried down here? In our own house?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Proof he's declawed. As for him, we buried him good and deep.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Give me the key, mother.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: I don't even have it on me, so forget it.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Guess I should'n'a done it.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just sleep now, Mom.

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: Just wanted to protect you, Nan. Just wanted to protect you...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Feeling better?

turns.speaker: MARGE
turns.text: They say you've bottomed out when you can't remember the night before.  No more drinking, Baby, suddenly I just don't feel like it any more.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: We got her mother's bed. You two got the rest.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: We should get her out of here...

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Your old man thinks I did it, don't he?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: He doesn't know you.  Couldn't you change?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: The cops were all over my house.  They'll kill me for sure.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Nobody's gonna kill you.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I never touched her.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You were screaming like crazy.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Someone else was there.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: The door was locked from your side.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: And then what happened?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I told you.  It was dark, but I'm sure there was someone else IN there, under the covers with her.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: How could somebody get under the covers with you guys without you knowing it?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: How the fuck do I know?  I don't expect you to believe me.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Well then how can you say somebody else was there?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Because somebody cut her. While I watched.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What you mean 'all at once'?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I mean, it was as if there were four razors cutting her at the same time. But invisible razors. She just... opened up...

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Do you think I did it?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Rod says the sweetest things.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: He's nuts about you.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Yeah, nuts.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Anyway, I'm too tired to worry about the creep. Couldn't get back to sleep at all.  So what you dream?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Forget it, the point is, everybody has nightmares once in a while. No biggy.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: I can't believe his mother let him come over here.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Right. Well, she didn't, exactly...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Nice to have a fire.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Really. Turn 'er up a little.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Maybe we should call Rod, have him come over too. He might get jealous.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Rod and I are done. He's too much of a maniac.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: What you dream?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I dreamed about this guy in a dirty red and yellow sweater; I dream in color, y'know; he walked into the room I was in, right, right through the wall, like it was smoke or something, and just stared at me. Sort of... obscenely. Then he walked out through the wall on the other side. Like he'd just come to check me out...

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: What the hell you doing here?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Came to make up, no big deal. Your ma home?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Of course. What's that?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: You feel better now, right?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Jungle man fix Jane.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: No more fights?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: No more fights.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Good. No more nightmares for either of us then.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: When did you have a nightmare?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Guys can have nightmares too, y'know. You ain't got a corner on the fucking market or something.

turns.speaker: ALL THREE RUSSIANS
turns.text: Thank you, Comrade.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Have you any money?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Well, here are fifty francs.

turns.speaker: ALL THREE RUSSIANS
turns.text: Thank you, Comrade, thank you.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Bring me forty-five back.

turns.speaker: ALL THREE RUSSIANS
turns.text: Naturally, Comrade.

turns.speaker: ALL THREE RUSSIANS
turns.text: What is it, Ninotchka?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: It's from Paris.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: From Leon.

turns.speaker: ALL THREE RUSSIANS
turns.text: From Leon!... How is he?... Come, tell us... open it... tell us... how is he?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Good evening, Anna.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Good evening, Ninotchka.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Aren't you late?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, the opera starts an hour later tonight on account of the parade.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: They didn't let me. I am in disgrace. Last week at the performance of Carmen I played a sour note. The conductor got so excited he yelled, "There's sabotage in the string section!"

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Too bad... you missed an inspiring day, Anna.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I know... my heart is sad... but my feet are happy. When all the tanks and guns were roaring over the Red Square I sat here all by myself and played a Beethoven sonata. Not bad at all.  Are you expecting someone?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: A few friends... just a little dinner party.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What are you serving?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: An omelet.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: An omelet! Aren't you living a little above your ration?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Well, I've saved up two eggs and each of my friends is bringing his own so we'll manage.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It just goes to prove the theory of our State. If you stand alone it means a boiled egg but if you're true to the collective spirit and stick together you've got an omelet.  That reminds me... have you heard the latest they're telling about the Kremlin?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'll tell you later.  That Gurganov, you never know whether he's on his way to the washroom or the Secret Police.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: You should be more careful, Anna.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And you too, Ninotchka.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Ever since you have been back from Paris...

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: I haven't talked to anyone about Paris. I haven't said a word.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's just it. It makes people feel queer. I dont' want you to get in any trouble.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: I have nothing to hide.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You should. I'll show you.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: When I passed through the laundry yard today I saw all the women huddled around this so I brought it up here. Things like this create a bad feeling. First they didn't know whose it was. Then they saw the Paris label and did it start a commotion! Some said it's what we all ought to wear and others said it's like hanging foreign ideas on our clothesline. It undermines our whole cause.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know how it is today... all you have to do is wear a pair of silk stockings and they suspect you of counter-revolution.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Thank you, Anna. I'll dry it up here when I wash it next. I should hate to see our country endangered by my underwear.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Ninotchka, you know I am your friend, you can trust me.... Did you bring back anything else?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: No, I left everything in Paris. I just happened to be wearing this.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Tell me... what else did you have?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Well, a hat...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What was it like?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: It was very silly.... I would be ashamed to wear it here.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: As beautiful as that? What else? Come, tell me.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: An evening gown.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Evening gown?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: A dress you wear in the evening.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What do you wear in the morning?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: When you get up you put on a negligee, and then you change to a morning frock.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You mean to tell me you wear a different dress for different times of the day?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Now, Ninotchka, you're exaggerating.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: No, my dear, it is true. That's how they live in the other world. Here we dress to have our bodies covered... to keep warm....

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And there?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Well, sometimes they're not completely covered but... they don't freeze.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: They must have wonderful materials to make a thing like this so soft... something you don't even see.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: You feel it, though.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Ninotchka, I wouldn't bring this up if we weren't such good friends.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: What is it, Anna?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know I told you that Pavlov and I are going to get married when he comes back from the maneuvers. Would it be asking too much...

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: You want this?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Just for the honeymoon.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: You can have it for good. It is my wedding present.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Are you the Buljanoff who fought on the barricades? And now you are afraid to take a room with a bath?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: I don't want to go to Siberia.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Comrades! Comrades! Don't let's give in so quickly. After all we have to uphold the prestige of Russia.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: All right, let's uphold it for another ten minutes.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: You wouldn't like Razinin.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: He's a bad man. Sends people to Siberia!

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: And how is Lord Lavenham?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: ...and little Lady Beatrice?

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Are we free, Buljanoff?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Possibly.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: No, that's not him...

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Positively not!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: That's her.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Imagine! The niece of the Czar opening the door for us.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Once in Petersburg I was driving down the Nevsky Prospect in my cart and Her Highness in her troika swept down from the opposite direction, and when I couldn't make way quick enough she spat in my face.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: You must help us, Leon... if you don't win her over we're on our way to Siberia!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Or it might be the firing squad!

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Or we can't go back to Russia!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Imagine, for once in our lives we were in Paris and we never went to the Eiffel Tower.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: If you hadn't given Commissar Razinin such a wonderful report about us, who knows what would have happened?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: I can tell you exactly.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: A little more tact... look how nicely she's fixed the table -- all for us.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: How nicely you've fixed the table, Ninotchka.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Can you blame them?... at least the May Day parade is over.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: That's another thing... it's spring.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: It is, Ninotchka! It is! He must have been in Paris! You can see it in his whole attitude! He just picked up a crumb of our black bread, shook his head, and dropped it.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: If you asked him why he left France I bet he couldn't name one good reason.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: I should be a swallow! Right now I would be sitting in front of the Café de Paris picking up flakes of French pastry that would melt in my bill.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Let's fill it with confitures, des prunes...

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: ...des raisins de Madère, des framboises...

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: And the surprise is there's nothing in it.

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: I know, but if we can't put in all these wonderful things at least let's put in some imagination.  In that one omelet we'll taste the whole of Paris!

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: We are not comrades any more... we are friends, Ninotchka.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Imagine, we don't have to whisper any longer.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: ...it may step out of a bazaar... it may wait for you in a corridor... it may hide in the shadow of a minaret....

turns.speaker: KOPALSKI
turns.text: Right now it's on the balcony.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Just a minute -- just a minute -- I have nothing against the idea but I still say let's go back to the Hotel Terminus. Moscow made our reservations there, we are on an official mission, and we have no right to change the orders of our superior.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: Where is your courage, Comrade Buljanoff?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Now Comrades, I warn you... if it gets out in Moscow that we stay in the Royal Suite we will get into terrible trouble.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: We'll just say we had to take it on account of the safe. That's a perfect excuse. There was no other safe big enough.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: Capitalistic methods...

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: They accumulate millions by taking loss after loss.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: He's cutting our throat...

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: But what can we do?... We have to accept.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: We don't like Razinin.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: We like you, Leon -- don't we like Leon?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Misha! Misha!

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: A telegram from Moscow! It must have been here all day!

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: That must be the one!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Yes, he looks like a comrade!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: We had to take it on account of the safe.

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: For ourselves... we are much happier now since we moved to a little room next to the servants' quarters.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: And Leonitchka! What she said about us...!

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: And they might believe her in Moscow.

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: What do you mean they might -- they will!

turns.speaker: BULJANOFF
turns.text: Yes! We could stay with Leon!

turns.speaker: IRANOFF
turns.text: Leon, how would you like to have three lifelong friends?
